title: Backend / API Engineer, PayInsights
content:
Who we are
About Stripe
Stripe is a financial infrastructure platform for businesses. Millions of companies—from the world’s largest enterprises to the most ambitious startups—use Stripe to accept payments, grow their revenue, and accelerate new business opportunities. Our mission is to increase the GDP of the internet, and we have a staggering amount of work ahead. That means you have an unprecedented opportunity to put the global economy within everyone’s reach while doing the most important work of your career.
About the team
The PayInsights team is looking for a Backend Engineer to build and operate infrastructure to enable reliable and enhanced payment performance. Our work helps users boost conversion rates, prevent auth rate regressions, and ultimately maximize revenue through scaled and optimized payments acceptance strategies. 
We are responsible for: 
Data foundations and observability platform to detect user-level and issuer-level changes in payments performance metrics
Merchant-facing products to help users understand how they’re doing and find revenue and conversion opportunities for their business
Issuer-facing products like the Enhanced Issuer Network and its various risk data sharing programs that provide issuers with more details to help improve authorization rates and reduce fraud.  
Engineers on this team can work on anything from building realtime datasets and anomaly detection to experimenting with new prospective conversion optimizations and helping merchants become aware of and benefit from these optimizations.
What you’ll do
Responsibilities
Design, build, and maintain data-oriented products and platforms to help merchants, issuers, and account teams understand performance, find ways to boost conversion, and ultimately maximize revenue.
Collaborate with stakeholders across the company including other engineering and products teams who own products that impact performance, account teams who 
Run experiments to find new ways of improving auth performance, and debug production issues that are hurting merchant revenue.  
Improve engineering standards, tooling, and processes.
Teach and mentor others in the team to become the next generation of leaders at Stripe.
Who you are
We’re looking for someone who meets the minimum requirements to be considered for the role. If you meet these requirements, you are encouraged to apply. The preferred qualifications are a bonus, not a requirement.
Minimum requirements
You have experience (or interest!) in working with data pipelines and products (batch and/or streaming).
You have experience (or interest!) in running A/B experiments and analyzing results to understand impact.
You are creative, deeply analytical, and enjoy solving complex business problems using technology. 
You can work independently and with others to work through ambiguity and bring clarity to complex business and technical problems.
You thrive in a collaborative environment involving different teams, stakeholders, and subject matter experts.
Preferred qualifications
Experience developing in Java and Ruby.
Experience with big-data technologies like Scala, Flink or Pinot.
You are comfortable working on a new product under fluid conditions, balancing tactical and strategic considerations.
You have a strong technical background, including 3+ years of experience designing and engineering large-scale systems.

compliance.description: <p>PUBLIC BURDEN STATEMENT: According to the Paperwork Reduction Act of 1995 no persons are required to respond to a collection of information unless such collection displays a valid OMB control number. This survey should take about 5 minutes to complete.</p>

questions.label: Please select the country where you currently reside.
Please select the country or countries you anticipate working in for the role in which you are applying.
Are you authorized to work in the location(s) you selected in your previous response?
Will you require Stripe to sponsor you for a work permit now or in the future for the location(s) you selected in in your previous response?

questions.description: Stripe is currently operating in a hybrid work environment. In-office expectations for office-assigned Stripes vary by team. A remote location, in most cases, is defined as living 50 miles or more from an office location. While you would be welcome to join the office for team or business meetings when necessary, the expectation would be that you would regularly work from home rather than a Stripe office location. Stripe offices are located in Amsterdam, Bangkok, Bengaluru, Berlin, Chicago, Dubai, Dublin, Jakarta, London, Madrid, Mexico City, New York City, Paris, São Paulo, Singapore, South San Francisco, Seattle, Tokyo, and Toronto. Stripe does not cover the cost of relocating to a remote location. We encourage you to apply for roles that match the location in which you live or have intentions to live.
questions.label: If this role offers the option to work from a remote location, do you plan to work remotely?

values.label: Yes, I intend to work remotely.
No, I intend to work from an office location.
